page.title: 19FARMING IN BALMEDIE
page.content: Mr Christie who is a local farmer owns a field in our area, which is surrounded by trees like many other fields in the area we are studying.In Mr Christie's field he grows winter barley. There is a croft by the name of Drumhead Croft. The owners have a small acreage of land and keep a small number of cattle and sheep. Their land is slightly hilly and is good for growing grass. In Balmedie there is Eigie Farm they do not use it for farming any more. It has an old farmhouse which is now a ruin. There are many fields around it with cattle and sheep. Most of the other farmlands in our area are either rotational grasslands or cereal crops. Down towards the sand-dunes there is rough grazing for the cattle and sheep.
